Description: Sherd, made up of three joining fragments, from upper part of black-figure painted pottery situla. Lion attacking supine boar (and standing on its tail): below, lotus flower and palmette. Purple for mane of lion and crest and testicles of boar.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B106.16)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 604, 4 (and Pl. GB 597, 10)) (Group C13)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 253)
